2021-04-15 12:29:40

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by yopasa94

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1642|#1642 Tags for examples in scenario outlines is not supported>
<p>Cucumber Version: 7.0.1<br /> Node Version: 14.14.31<br /> Operating System: Win 10</p> <p>Scenario Outline: Sample test case<br /> Given this is a test case<br /> When I have the following data table<br /> | &lt;scenario_example&gt; |<br /> Then a JSON report will be generated</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/critical">@critical</a><br /> Examples:<br /> | scenario_example |<br /> | Test Child Tag 1 |</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/blocker">@blocker</a><br /> Examples:<br /> | scenario_example |<br /> | Test Child Tag 2 |</p> <p>When I run the test case above with the tag: "--tags <a href="https://github.com/critical">@critical</a>" and "-f json:reports/cucumber-report.json", the test case runs successfully, but the following error is thrown:<br /> ``[chrome <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1">#1</a>]<br /> [chrome <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1">#1</a>] 8 scenarios (8 passed)<br /> [chrome <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1">#1</a>] 48 steps (48 passed)<br /> [chrome <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1">#1</a>] 2m58.724s (executing steps: 2m58.252s)<br /> [chrome <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1">#1</a>] [14:22:34] I/runnerCli - Cannot read property 'location' of undefined</p> <p>[14:22:34] I/testLogger -</p> <p>[14:22:34] E/launcher - Runner process exited unexpectedly with error code: 1<br /> [14:22:34] I/launcher - 0 instance(s) of WebDriver still running<br /> Is there any way to support tag at the example level (it was supported in the past )? why was that feature removed ?<br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22714699/114927341-f7cf3680-9df6-11eb-8786-21003cdd73b1.png">image</a></p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1644|#1644 Allow using a HTTP proxy to send results>
<p>We should allow users behind a HTTP(S) proxy to publish results. The implementation could be based on <a href="https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-https-proxy-agent">https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-https-proxy-agent</a></p>
Labels
‚úÖ accepted, ‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-04-20 17:47:47

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by jan-molak

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1646|#1646 Changes in 7.2.0 break external reporters>
<p>Hey <a href="https://github.com/davidjgoss">@davidjgoss</a> and <a href="https://github.com/charlierudolph">@charlierudolph</a>!</p> <p>It looks like support for ESM introduced in <code>7.2.0</code> (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1589">#1589</a>) breaks a number of external reporters, as it no longer allows for sub-module imports.</p> <p>This manifests itself with an error in projects that attempt a sub-module import.</p> <p>For example, calling either:</p> <pre><code>const TestCaseHookDefinition = require('@cucumber/cucumber/lib/models/test_case_hook_definition') </code></pre> <p>or:</p> <pre><code>import TestCaseHookDefinition from '@cucumber/cucumber/lib/models/test_case_hook_definition'; </code></pre> <p>results in:</p> <pre><code>Error [ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]: Package subpath './lib/models/test_case_hook_definition' is not defined by "exports" in /path/to/project/node_modules/@cucumber/cucumber/package.json </code></pre> <p>Affected projects I'm aware of (there could be more):</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Serenity/JS - <code>@serenity-js/cucumber</code> module relies on following sub-module imports: ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/package.js</code> (to read the version) ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/models/test_case_hook_definition</code> - to instantiate <code>TestCaseHookDefinition</code> ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://github.com/jbpros">@jbpros</a> <code>cucumber-pretty-formatter</code> - see <a href="https://github.com/jbpros/cucumber-pretty-formatter/issues/2">jbpros/cucumber-pretty-formatter#2</a>, which relies on loading: ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/formatter</code> - <code>IFormatterOptions</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/formatter/helpers</code> - <code>formatLocation</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/formatter/helpers/gherkin_document_parser</code> - <code>getGherkinExampleRuleMap</code>, <code>getGherkinScenarioMap</code>, <code>getGherkinStepMap</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/formatter/helpers/pickle_parser</code> - <code>getPickleStepMap</code> ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://github.com/christian-bromann">@christian-bromann</a> - <code>@wdio/cucumber-framework</code>, which loads: ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types</code> - <code>ITestCaseHookParameter</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/formatter/helpers/event_data_collector</code> - <code>EventDataCollector</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types</code> - <code>ITestCaseHookParameter</code> ‚Ä¢ <code>@cucumber/cucumber/lib/runtime</code> - <code>IRuntimeOptions</code></p> <p>Would it be possible for Cucumber.js to export the above classes, types, and functions, for example under <code>reporters</code> namespace (or something similar so that they don't get in the way of regular users):</p> <pre><code>import { reporters } from '@cucumber/cucumber'; reporters.TestCaseHookDefinition </code></pre> <p>Alternatively, would it be possible to revert those changes if the above proposal requires too much work?</p> <p>Thanks,<br /> Jan</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub

2021-04-21 07:44:37

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by mattwynne

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1648|#1648 Replace uses of `any` type with the proper type>
<p>When we converted cucumber-js from JavaScript to TypeScript, we used the <code>any</code> type quite liberally to hasten the process.</p> <p>We have a long-term goal to replace all instances of <code>any</code> with the suitable type.</p> <p>This would make a great first-timer contribution to potter around in the code and get to know it. As always, you can find the commiters in the <a href="https://cucumber.io/community#slack">https://cucumber.io/community#slack</a> if you need any guidance.</p>
Labels
üè¶ debt, good first issue
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-04-21 07:49:53

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1647|#1647 temporarily revert ESM change>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue closed by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1646|#1646 Changes in 7.2.0 break external reporters>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-04-22 12:47:00

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1650|#1650 cli: undeprecate json formatter>
<p>Closes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1250">#1250</a> as agreed in today's community call for all implementations.</p> <p>The previous deprecation has resulted in some hesitation to upgrade from users who use tools that rely on the JSON formatter output.</p> <p>The tone now is about "maintenance mode" - it'll stay functional, but won't benefit from any new features. As the documentation and tooling around messages improves, we'll gradually encourage authors of maintained tools to switch over to that. Feedback welcome on the exact wording. Also, the noisy console warning is gone.</p>
Comments
1
Reviewers
aslakhellesoy, mattwynne, charlierudolph
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1662|#1662 replace use of Dictionary with Record>
<p>Helps with <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1532">#1532</a> - avoids an implicit dependency on <code>@types/lodash</code> where TypeScript users reference some of our models and functions.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1663|#1663 docs: add note about resolveJsonModule for TS>
<p>Last piece of <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1532">#1532</a>.</p> <p>We need TypeScript users to have this on due to an upstream library that exports typings doing an <code>import</code> of a JSON file. I think this is very common and it seems more sensible to advise users to switch the compiler option on than try to control what goes on in libraries.</p>
Comments
1
Reviewers
charlierudolph, aurelien-reeves

2021-05-02 13:52:59

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by plocket

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1664|#1664 Feature: Allow non-formatted data table in final log>
<p>Our data table has some very long strings in it. The final log tries to make all the columns line up. That combination makes the whole table quite a lot longer than it needs to be. We'd prefer that the log not attempt to make the table columns all the same width.</p>
Labels
‚ö° enhancement
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-05-04 07:05:55

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by ggarcia24

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1665|#1665 --no-strict flag has no effect when using cucumber.js file and --profile>
<p>Hello, first of all thank you very much for porting this tool to javascript! I've found an issue with the --profile flag, I've followed the 10 minutes guide for cucumber-js (<a href="https://cucumber.io/docs/guides/10-minute-tutorial/">https://cucumber.io/docs/guides/10-minute-tutorial/</a>), I've modified some things from the tutorial to run in the following way:</p> <p>Directory structure:</p> <pre><code>|- features |- is_it_friday_yet.feature | -src |- step_definitions |- stepdefs.js |- support |- hooks.js |- custom_parameters.js |- world.js |- README.md |- cucumber.js </code></pre> <pre><code>// cucumber.js onst DEFAULT_OPTIONS = [ '--no-strict', '--require src/support/hooks.js', '--require src/support/custom_parameters.js', '--require src/support/world.js', '--require src/step_definitions/****/**.js', '--publish-quiet', ]; const cliOpts = DEFAULT_OPTIONS.join(' '); module.exports = { // The default is only run on dev machines default: `${cliOpts} --format progress-bar --format-options '{"snippetInterface": "synchronous"}' --tags @wip`, all: `${cliOpts} --format message:output/cucumber-messages.ndjson --retry 3 --retry-tag-filter @flacky`, } </code></pre> <pre><code>// stepdefs.js const { Given, When, Then } = require('@cucumber/cucumber'); Given('today is Sunday', function () { // Write code here that turns the phrase above into concrete return 'pending'; }); When('I ask whether it\'s Friday yet', function () { // Write code here that turns the phrase above into concrete actions return 'pending'; }); Then('I should be told {string}', function (string) { // Write code here that turns the phrase above into concrete actions return 'pending'; }); </code></pre> <p>Running the command line with <code>--profile all</code> returns error code 1 when it shouldn't</p> <pre><code>$ cucumber-js --profile all ... $ echo $? 1 </code></pre> <p>But if I expand the command line to include all the information included in the profile everything works file</p> <pre><code>$ cucumber-js --no-strict --require src/support/hooks.js --require src/support/custom_parameters.js --require src/support/world.js --require "src/step_definitions/****/**.js" --publish-quiet --format message:output/cucumber-messages.ndjson --retry 3 --retry-tag-filter @flacky $ echo $? 0 </code></pre> <p>I'm currently investigating if I can solve the issue, hope to create a PR.</p> <p>Best regards<br /> Gonzalo</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-05-05 03:38:50

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request merged by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1663|#1663 docs: add note about resolveJsonModule for TS>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

2021-05-05 05:21:47

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by jaheikki

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1666|#1666 Cucumber js v.7 cli does not allow additional command line options anymore >
<p>Cucumber js version 6.x supports giving additional (non-cucumber) command line options, but it does not work anymore with Cucumber js 7.x!</p> <p>Error message with Cucumber js v7.2.1:<br /> node_modules/.bin/cucumber-js ./e2e/features --require-module @babel/register --configuration android.emu.release<br /> error: unknown option '--configuration'</p> <p>Tested with both Cucumber js v.6.x and v.7.x, node --version: v15.14.0, detox --version: 17.13.2, Mac OS Catalina 10.15.7</p> <p>This is needed e.g. with Cucumber js &amp; Detox (for React-native testing) where it is mandatory to use Detox command line options like "--configuration". "--configuration" is Detox command line option and not Cucumber js command line option.</p> <p>For example this works with Cucumber 6.x but not with 7.x:<br /> node_modules/.bin/cucumber-js ./e2e/features --require-module @babel/register --configuration android.emu.release</p> <p>See:<br /> <a href="https://github.com/mathanpec/react-native-detox-cucumber">https://github.com/mathanpec/react-native-detox-cucumber</a></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-05-05 06:40:11

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by MilanJimi

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1667|#1667 World is not properly typed in the latest wersion>
<p>Node v12.19.0, TypeScript v4.2.4, @cucumber/cucumber v7.2.1, Ubuntu v20.04</p> <p>I can no longer use <code>World</code> in my tests, because <code>this</code> is no longer typed inside the <code>Given/When/Then</code> functions, instead defaulting to being typed as <code>any</code>.</p> <p>If I downgrade to version <code>cucumber v7.0.0-rc.0</code>, <code>this</code> is properly typed as <code>World</code>.<br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6137091/117426798-9cd7bd80-af24-11eb-9a38-671d5fbfcb97.png">image</a></p> <p><a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6137091/117426338-14591d00-af24-11eb-9e41-6aef83557184.png">image</a></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-05-12 08:41:18

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by yopasa94

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1668|#1668 WIP Scenario: Cannot read property 'uri' of undefined>
<p>Hello,</p> <p>I've found a issue when I try to run all scenarios (including wip) using dry-run mode. I.E:</p> <p>This is the feature file, I'm trying to run</p> <p>` <a href="https://github.com/blocker">@blocker</a> <a href="https://github.com/wip">@wip</a><br /> Scenario: Login to application<br /> Given Go to the App<br /> When I enter user credential<br /> Then App home should be displayed</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/major">@major</a> <a href="https://github.com/wip">@wip</a><br /> Scenario: Login using a external app</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/minor">@minor</a> <a href="https://github.com/wip">@wip</a><br /> Scenario: Login using token<br /> `</p> <p>When I try to run a feature like that I got this error<br /> [10:38:10] E/launcher - <strong>Error: TypeError: Cannot read property 'uri' of undefined</strong><br /> at parseStep (~node<em>modules@cucumber\cucumber\src\formatter\helpers\test</em>case<em>attempt</em>parser.ts:90:27)<br /> at ~node<em>modules@cucumber\cucumber\src\formatter\helpers\test</em>case<em>attempt</em>parser.ts:169:24</p> <p>I took a look into the code and seems likely the app does not support scenarios without steps.</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/f37edaadbefea557d87ef5f19bc301a277ac4264/src/formatter/helpers/test_case_attempt_parser.ts#L55">cucumber-js/src/formatter/helpers/test<em>case</em>attempt_parser.ts</a></p> <p>Line 55 in &lt;/cucumber/cucumber-js/commit/f37edaadbefea557d87ef5f19bc301a277ac4264|f37edaa&gt;</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by binarymist

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1675|#1675 requireing @cucumber/gherkin-streams fails>
<p>Upgrading from:</p> <p>"@cucumber/cucumber": "7.0.0",<br /> "@cucumber/gherkin": "17.0.2",</p> <p>To:</p> <p>"@cucumber/cucumber": "7.2.1",<br /> "@cucumber/gherkin-streams": "2.0.2"</p> <p><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/@cucumber/gherkin-streams">doc</a> says to require the <code>fromPaths</code> like the following:</p> <p><code>const { fromPaths } = require('@cucumber/gherkin-streams')</code></p> <p>When I do this <code>fromPaths</code> is <code>undefined</code>.</p> <p>Although if I run in the debugger:</p> <p><code>require('@cucumber/gherkin-streams');</code></p> <p>I get:</p> <pre><code>{GherkinStreams: {‚Ä¶}, __esModule: true} GherkinStreams: {fromPaths: ∆í, fromSources: ∆í} __esModule: true __proto__: Object </code></pre> <p>Is there some sort of additional undocumented trick to require <code>fromPaths</code> or is this a bug?</p> <p>I've read the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/gherkin/CHANGELOG.md">Changelog</a></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1681|#1681 chore(deps): update dependency tsd to v0.16.0>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> SamVerschueren/tsd <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/releases/v0.16.0"><code>v0.16.0</code></a></strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/compare/v0.15.1...v0.16.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Upgrade to TypeScript@4.2.4 <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/05f9f3b"><code>05f9f3b</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Fix missing ES types regression in 0.15 (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/100">#‚Äã100</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/b39bd98"><code>b39bd98</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Handle multiple diagnostic errors in a single <code>expectError</code> assertion (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/103">#‚Äã103</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/87f7109"><code>87f7109</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Allow <code>expectError</code> directives to detect parameter count mismatches (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/102">#‚Äã102</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/8fe3924"><code>8fe3924</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Allow <code>expectError</code> assertions to detect non-callable/non-constructable values/expressions (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/104">#‚Äã104</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/27ccc49"><code>27ccc49</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Allow <code>expectError</code> assertions to detect <code>this</code> type mismatches on class methods (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/105">#‚Äã105</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/commit/abf7082"><code>abf7082</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Detect "Type X has no properties in common with type Y" in <code>expectError</code> (TS2559) (<a href="https://togithub.com/SamVerschueren/tsd/issues/97">#‚Äã97</a>) <a [cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1685|#1685 chore(deps): update dependency fs-extra to v10>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> jprichardson/node-fs-extra <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B1000--2021-05-03|&lt;code">https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B1000--2021-05-03|<code</a>v10.0.0</code>&gt;</strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/compare/9.1.0...10.0.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p><strong>Breaking changes</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Require Node.js v12+ (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/886">#‚Äã886</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/893">#‚Äã893</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/890">#‚Äã890</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/894">#‚Äã894</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/895">#‚Äã895</a>) ‚Ä¢ Allow copying broken symlinks (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/779">#‚Äã779</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/765">#‚Äã765</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/638">#‚Äã638</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/761">#‚Äã761</a>)</p> <p><strong>The following changes, although technically semver-major, will not affect the vast majority of users:</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Ensure correct type when destination exists for <code>ensureLink**()</code>/<code>ensureSymlink**()</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/826">#‚Äã826</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/786">#‚Äã786</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/870">#‚Äã870</a>) ‚Ä¢ Error when attempting to <code>copy**()</code> unknown file type (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/880">#‚Äã880</a>) ‚Ä¢ Remove undocumented options for <code>remove**()</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/882">#‚Äã882</a>)</p> <p><strong>Improvements</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Allow changing case of filenames with <code>move**()</code>, even on technically case-insensitive filesystems (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/759">#‚Äã759</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/801">#‚Äã801</a>) ‚Ä¢ Use native <code>fs.rm**()</code> for <code>remove**()</code> in environments that support it (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/882">#‚Äã882</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/806">#‚Äã806</a>) ‚Ä¢ Improve <code>emptyDir()</code> performance (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/885">#‚Äã885</a>)</p> <p><strong>Bugfixes</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Ensure <code>copy**()</code>'s <code>filter</code> function is not called more than necessary (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/883">#‚Äã883</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/809">#‚Äã809</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fix <code>move**()</code> raising <code>EPERM</code> error when moving a file to the root of a drive on Windows (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/897">#‚Äã897</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/819">#‚Äã819</a>)</p> <p><strong>Miscellaneous changes</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Do not use <code>at-least-node</code> as a dependency (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/896">#‚Äã896</a>) ‚Ä¢ Improve documentation (<a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/888">#‚Äã888</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/830">#‚Äã830</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/pull/884">#‚Äã884</a>, <a [cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1687|#1687 chore(deps): update dependency ts-node to v10>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> TypeStrong/ts-node <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/releases/v10.0.0"><code>v10.0.0</code></a></strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/compare/v9.1.1...v10.0.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p>Questions about this release? Ask in the official discussion thread: <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1337">#‚Äã1337</a></p> <p><em>Breaking changes are prefixed with <strong>[BREAKING]</strong></em></p> <p><strong>Added</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Adds <code>--show-config</code> to log the resolved configuration (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/troubleshooting#understanding-configuration">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1100">#‚Äã1100</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1243">#‚Äã1243</a>) ‚Ä¢ Bundle and re-export <a href="https://togithub.com/tsconfig/node">@‚Äãtsconfig/node</a><em>* configurations for convenience (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/configuration#tsconfigbases">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1202">#‚Äã1202</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1236">#‚Äã1236</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1313">#‚Äã1313</a>) ‚Ä¢ Default to appropriate <a href="https://togithub.com/tsconfig/node">@‚Äãtsconfig/node</a></em>* configuration based on node and typescript versions (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/configuration#default-config">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1202">#‚Äã1202</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1236">#‚Äã1236</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1313">#‚Äã1313</a>) ‚Ä¢ Automatically reference <a href="https://togithub.com/types/node">@‚Äãtypes/node</a>; use globally-installed <a href="https://togithub.com/types/node">@‚Äãtypes/node</a> if not locally installed (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1240">#‚Äã1240</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1257">#‚Äã1257</a>) ‚Ä¢ Add <code>swc</code> integration and new <code>--transpiler</code> option to use third-party transpilers for a massive speed boost on large codebases (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/transpilers">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/779">#‚Äã779</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1160">#‚Äã1160</a>) ‚Ä¢ Add <code>scopeDir</code> API option (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/api/interfaces/RegisterOptions.html#scopeDir">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ Add <code>projectSearchDir</code> API option (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/api/interfaces/RegisterOptions.html#projectSearchDir">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ Add <code>--cwd-mode</code> and <code>ts-node-cwd</code> to resolve config file relative to cwd, not entrypoint script (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>)</p> <p><strong>Changed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> Make <code>--script-mode</code> default behavior; resolve tsconfig relative to entrypoint script instead of cwd (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/949">#‚Äã949</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1197">#‚Äã1197</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ In most cases this change will have no noticeable effect ‚Ä¢ Primarily benefits portable shell scripts on your <code>$PATH</code>, because <code>ts-node</code> will respect the script's local <code>tsconfig.json</code> ‚Ä¢ Use <code>--cwd-mode</code> or <code>ts-node-cwd</code> if you need legacy behavior ‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> <code>ignore</code> rules evaluate relative to <code>tsconfig.json</code> directory, otherwise <code>cwd</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> Remove support for node 10. Minimum supported version is node 12 (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1312">#‚Äã1312</a>) ‚Ä¢ Rename <code>--dir</code> to <code>--cwd</code>; rename <code>TS_NODE_DIR</code> to <code>TS_NODE_CWD</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ <code>--dir</code> and <code>TS_NODE_DIR</code> are deprecated but still parsed for backwards-compatibility ‚Ä¢ <code>--dir</code> effectively changed the working directory of <code>ts-node</code>; renaming makes this behavior more obvious</p> <p><strong>Deprecated</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Deprecate <code>TS_NODE_SCOPE</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ Deprecate <code>--dir</code> and <code>TS_NODE_DIR</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>)</p> <p><strong>Removed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> Internal APIs removed from type declarations (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1242">#‚Äã1242</a>) ‚Ä¢ Removed <code>DEFAULTS</code>, <code>normalizeSlashes</code>, <code>parse</code>, <code>split</code> ‚Ä¢ No features were removed ‚Ä¢ This will only affect consumers of <code>ts-node</code>'s programmatic API</p> <p><strong>Fixed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1229">#‚Äã1229</a> and <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1235">#‚Äã1235</a>: always throw <code>ERR_REQUIRE_ESM</code> when attempting to execute ESM as CJS, even when not using <code>--loader ts-node/esm</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1232">#‚Äã1232</a>) ‚Ä¢ This aligns our behavior with vanilla <code>node</code> ‚Ä¢ <strong>[BREAKING]</strong> Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1225">#‚Äã1225</a>: <code>compiler</code> is loaded relative to <code>tsconfig.json</code> instead of entrypoint script (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ In most cases this change will have no noticable effect ‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1217">#‚Äã1217</a>: REPL not always using passed stdout and stderr (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1224">#‚Äã1224</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1220">#‚Äã1220</a>: <code>ts-node ./index</code> may execute the wrong file extension because tsconfig search poisons the <code>require.resolve</code> cache (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1155">#‚Äã1155</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1322">#‚Äã1322</a>: Sourcemaps fail for filenames with spaces or other characters which are percent-encoded in URLs (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1160">#‚Äã1160</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1330">#‚Äã1330</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1331">#‚Äã1331</a>: Resolution of node builtin modules in ESM loader fails on node &gt;=12.20.0, &lt;13 (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1332">#‚Äã1332</a>)</p> <p><strong>Docs</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ New documentation website: <a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node">https://typestrong.org/ts-node</a> ‚Ä¢ README is generated to match the website ‚Ä¢ Added page explaining CommonJS vs ESM ‚Ä¢ Added page with Performance advice ‚Ä¢ Added Troubleshooting page ‚Ä¢ Organized and added to "Recipes" section with third-party tool integrations ‚Ä¢ Added TypeDoc-generated API docs ‚Ä¢ Work was spread across multiple tickets: <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1207">#‚Äã1207</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1213">#‚Äã1213</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1221">#‚Äã1221</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1228">#‚Äã1228</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1244">#‚Äã1244</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1250">#‚Äã1250</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1294">#‚Äã1294</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1295">#‚Äã1295</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1296">#‚Äã1296</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1297">#‚Äã1297</a> ‚Ä¢ Thanks to these contributors for PRs which improved our documentation ‚Ä¢ add troubleshooting tip for syntax errors (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1201">#‚Äã1201</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/jedwards1211">@‚Äãjedwards1211</a> ‚Ä¢ Clarify handling of tsx/jsx file extensions (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1179">#‚Äã1179</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/NaridaL">@‚ÄãNaridaL</a> ‚Ä¢ Added <code>CONTRIBUTING.md</code> to document the codebase and our development workflow</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/milestone/1">https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/milestone/1</a></p> <hr /> <p><strong>Configuration</strong></p> <p>üìÖ <strong>Schedule</strong>: "on the first day of the month" (UTC).</p> <p>üö¶ <strong>Automerge</strong>: Disabled by config. [cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by binarymist

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1689|#1689 Upgrade @cucumber/cucumber 7.0.0 -&gt; 7.1.0>
<p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>In upgradeing from "@cucumber/cucumber": "7.0.0" to "@cucumber/cucumber": "7.2.1" as per <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/1585">this issue</a> I had problems at 7.1.0.<br /> In looking at the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#fixed-2">Changelog</a>, I see <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1608/files">pr 1608</a> introduced a <code>stream.on</code> (in a ts file (I'm using js)). Correct me if I'm wrong, but this seems to assume that the cucumber stdout has an <code>on</code> function. I haven't seen this documented anywhere, what is the purpose of this? Also the actual change doesn't seem to be in the Changelog. I also can't find it in the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js</a> repository. I can only see it when I npm install @cucumber/cucumber 7.1.0. Where is this code?</p> <p>I've added <a href="https://github.com/purpleteam-labs/purpleteam-app-scanner/blob/06c5148c9f080388164a74ccf990e8ae18f7316f/src/scripts/runCuc.js#L42-L45">this</a> to get around the problem, but I have no idea what the <code>on</code> function is supposed to do?</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/purpleteam-labs/purpleteam-app-scanner/blob/06c5148c9f080388164a74ccf990e8ae18f7316f/src/scripts/runCuc.js#L63-L67">This is where/how</a> I've been instantiating the CLI for years.</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/purpleteam-labs/purpleteam-app-scanner/blob/06c5148c9f080388164a74ccf990e8ae18f7316f/src/api/app/models/app.parallel.js#L502-L505">This is how</a> I've been handling the CLI erros for years.</p> <p>Is my empty <code>on</code> function the way to do this, I'm struggling to understand what's going on here?</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1690|#1690 typescript: type this as any in user functions>
<p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1667">#1667</a>.</p> <p>I'd have preferred to type it as <code>World</code> rather than <code>any</code>, but this then prevents a user from overriding the type of <code>this</code> in their own function - going to try and find a clever way to address that (maybe with generics) in a follow up.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by znevrly

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1691|#1691 Timeouts in CucumberJS 7+ version not aligned with documentation>
<p>Hi,</p> <p>looking on <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/docs/support_files/timeouts.md">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/docs/support_files/timeouts.md</a> but it seems does not work in CucumberJS 7+ version.</p> <p>I have old code with setDefaultTimeout(timeoutInMilisec) in world and it worked for long time (version 6+). Now I got report that it does not work anymore with 7+ but not sure since because timeout is kind of edge case.</p> <p>Getting this message when different global timeout via setDefaultTimeout is set up:</p> <p>Error: function timed out, ensure the callback is executed within 30000 milliseconds</p> <p>When('step definition', {timeout: 100000}, callback)<br /> Setting timeout as step parameter works as expected but I have many steps and I want to set up globally.</p> <p>Thanks.</p>

But as it is about the migration from 6 to 7, we can argue that it does not have to be updated for each new version of messages.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1695|#1695 Do not exit in Cli>
<p>This prevents the process from calling <code>process.exit</code> when an error occurs during command line parsing.</p> <p>This is needed to make it easier to control when the process exits from tools that use Cucumber as a library (like <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-electron">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-electron</a>).</p> <p>I tried to prevent exit for <code>--help</code> and <code>--version</code>, but this was harder. We parse the command line twice (once to extract the <code>--profile</code>, and once again after reading the profile options), and this caused double rendering when <code>--version</code> was used.</p> <p>Circumventing this would mean one of the following:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Don't use commander to extract profiles ‚Ä¢ Set a custom <a href="https://github.com/tj/commander.js/#override-exit-and-output-handling">output handler</a></p> <p>This seemed too cumbersome, so I went with this compromise.</p>
Labels
‚ö° enhancement
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
‚úÖ All checks have passed
20/20 successful checks
GitHub
2021-06-10 04:53:59

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by evilC

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1696|#1696 Cucumber-js unable to handle Given and When steps with same step text>
<p>node 14.16.0<br /> @wdio/cli: 7.3.0<br /> @wdio/cucumber-framework: 7.3.0</p> <p>With the following code:</p> <pre><code>Scenario: Foo Given Foo Scenario Bar When Foo </code></pre> <pre><code>Given ("Foo", () =&amp;gt; { someFunc(); }); When ("Foo", () =&amp;gt; { someFunc(); }); function someFunc(){ } </code></pre> <p>When I run my tests with wdio, it fails to hit the first step with no obvious error</p> <p>In our project, we wish to re-use a step (ie same step can be used as a Given or a When step).<br /> What I currently do is this:</p> <pre><code>Given, // SonarQube says "Unexpected use of comma operator" for this line When("Foo", () =&amp;gt; { // some code here }); // SonarQube says "Expected an assignment or function call and instead saw an expression" for this line </code></pre> <p>However, when SonarQube runs, it flags the lines as mentioned in the comments as code smells, so I was hoping to use the syntax at the start of my post as a work-around. IMHO it really should work - there is no ambiguity there as to which step should be called at which point, and even if it does crash, it should give some kind of meaningful error</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-10 06:51:44

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1698|#1698 Strip ANSI colour escapes from STDOUT and STDERR when streams are not TTY>
<p>When <code>cucumber-js</code>' <code>STDERR</code> or <code>STDOUT</code> is redirected to a file, there are still ANSI escapes in the output.</p> <p>We should remove ANSI escapes when writing to a non-TTY stream.</p> <p>One of the reasons we should do this is that the suggestion to redirect <code>STDERR</code> to a file in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1458">#1458</a> makes it difficult to read the contents written to that file:</p> <pre><code>ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îêÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m View your Cucumber Report at: ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[1mÔøΩ[36mÔøΩ[4m&lt;https://reports.cucumber.io/reports/59fbb8b0-a625-4f0e-8c5b-284b95387f03ÔøΩ&gt;[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[1mThis report will self-destruct in 24h.ÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m Keep reports forever: ÔøΩ[4mÔøΩ[1mÔøΩ[36m&lt;https://reports.cucumber.io/profileÔøΩ&gt;[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îÇÔøΩ[0m ÔøΩ[32mÔøΩ[1m‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îòÔøΩ[0m </code></pre> <p>Since the ANSI escapes in this case come from the Cucumber Reports server (and not our own code), I suggest we implement this like this:</p> <pre><code>const stderr = process.stderr.pipe(replaceAnsiStream()) const stdout = process.stderr.pipe(replaceAnsiStream()) </code></pre> <p>See <a href="https://github.com/chalk/strip-ansi-stream">https://github.com/chalk/strip-ansi-stream</a></p> <p>Also see <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1050">#1050</a> which didn't <em>really</em> solve the problem of stripping ANSI - it just disallows using formatters that output ANSI.</p>
Labels
‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
Patrick Poon
2021-06-17 11:26:32

@Patrick Poon has joined the channel

2021-06-17 14:49:39

[cucumber/cucumber-js] New release Release - published by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/releases/tag/v7.3.0|Release - >
<p><strong>Added</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Experimental support for <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/gherkin/MARKDOWN_WITH_GHERKIN.md">Markdown</a><br /> (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1645">#1645</a>)</p> <p><strong>Changed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ All <code>testCase</code> messages now emitted upfront at the start of the run (relevant for formatter authors) (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1408">#1408</a><br /> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1669">#1669</a>) ‚Ä¢ Clarify that the JSON formatter will not be removed any time soon</p> <p><strong>Fixed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <code>this</code> now has correct TypeScript type in support code functions (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1667">#1667</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1690">#1690</a>) ‚Ä¢ Progress bar formatter now reports total step count correctly (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1579">#1579</a><br /> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1669">#1669</a>) ‚Ä¢ Rerun functionality will now run nothing if the rerun file is empty from the previous run (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1302">#1302</a> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1568">#1568</a>) ‚Ä¢ All messages now emitted with project-relative <code>uri</code>s<br /> (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1534">#1534</a><br /> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1672">#1672</a>) ‚Ä¢ Json formatter now works with tagged examples<br /> (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1621">#1621</a><br /> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1651">#1651</a>)</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-18 00:44:20

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1700|#1700 cucumber-js --help should list available formatters>
<p>Here is the output from 7.3.0:</p> <pre><code>Usage: cucumber-js [options] [&amp;lt;GLOB|DIR|FILE[:LINE]&amp;gt;...] Options: -v, --version output the version number -b, --backtrace show full backtrace for errors -d, --dry-run invoke formatters without executing steps (default: false) --exit force shutdown of the event loop when the test run has finished: cucumber will call process.exit (default: false) --fail-fast abort the run on first failure (default: false) -f, --format &amp;lt;TYPE[:PATH]&amp;gt; specify the output format, optionally supply PATH to redirect formatter output (repeatable) (default: []) --format-options &amp;lt;JSON&amp;gt; provide options for formatters (repeatable) (default: {}) --i18n-keywords &amp;lt;ISO 639-1&amp;gt; list language keywords (default: "") --i18n-languages list languages (default: false) --language &amp;lt;ISO 639-1&amp;gt; provide the default language for feature files (default: "en") --name &amp;lt;REGEXP&amp;gt; only execute the scenarios with name matching the expression (repeatable) (default: []) --no-strict succeed even if there are pending steps --order &amp;lt;TYPE[:SEED]&amp;gt; run scenarios in the specified order. Type should be `defined` or `random` (default: "defined") -p, --profile &amp;lt;NAME&amp;gt; specify the profile to use (repeatable) (default: []) --parallel &amp;lt;NUMBER_OF_WORKERS&amp;gt; run in parallel with the given number of workers (default: 0) --predictable-ids Use predictable ids in messages (option ignored if using parallel) (default: false) --publish Publish a report to &lt;https://reports.cucumber.io&gt; (default: false) --publish-quiet Don't print information banner about publishing reports (default: false) -r, --require &amp;lt;GLOB|DIR|FILE&amp;gt; require files before executing features (repeatable) (default: []) --require-module &amp;lt;NODE_MODULE&amp;gt; require node modules before requiring files (repeatable) (default: []) --retry &amp;lt;NUMBER_OF_RETRIES&amp;gt; specify the number of times to retry failing test cases (default: 0) (default: 0) --retryTagFilter, --retry-tag-filter &amp;lt;EXPRESSION&amp;gt; only retries the features or scenarios with tags matching the expression (repeatable). This option requires '--retry' to be specified. (default: "") -t, --tags &amp;lt;EXPRESSION&amp;gt; only execute the features or scenarios with tags matching the expression (repeatable) (default: "") --world-parameters &amp;lt;JSON&amp;gt; provide parameters that will be passed to the world constructor (repeatable) (default: {}) -h, --help display help for command For more details please visit &lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/master/docs/cli.md&gt; </code></pre> <p>For comparison, cucumber-ruby lists the available formatters:</p> <p>``` Usage: cucumber [options] [ [FILE|DIR|URL][:LINE[:LINE]**] ]+</p> <p>Examples: cucumber examples/i18n/en/features cucumber @rerun.txt (See --format rerun) cucumber examples/i18n/it/features/somma.feature:6:98:113 cucumber -s -i <a href="http://rubyurl.com/eeCl">http://rubyurl.com/eeCl</a></p> <pre><code> --publish Publish a report to &lt;https://reports.cucumber.io&gt; --publish-quiet Don't print information banner about publishing reports -r, --require LIBRARY|DIR Require files before executing the features. If this option is not specified, all **.rb files that are siblings of or below the features will be loaded auto- matically. Automatic loading is disabled when this option is specified; all loading becomes explicit. Files in directories named "support" are still always loaded first when their parent directories are required or if the "support" directories themselves are explicitly required. This option can be specified multiple times. --retry ATTEMPTS Specify the number of times to retry failing tests (default: 0) --i18n-languages List all available languages --i18n-keywords LANG List keywords for in a particular language Run with "--i18n help" to see all languages --fail-fast Exit immediately following the first failing scenario -f, --format FORMAT How to format features (Default: pretty). Available formats: html : Outputs HTML report json : Prints the feature as JSON. The JSON format is in maintenance mode. Please consider using the message formatter with the standalone json-formatter (&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/json-formatter&gt;). junit : Generates a report similar to Ant+JUnit. Use junit,fileattribute=true to include a file attribute. message : Outputs protobuf messages pretty : Prints the feature as is - in colours. progress : Prints one character per scenario. rerun : Prints failing files with line numbers. stepdefs : Prints All step definitions with their locations. Same as the usage formatter, except that steps are not printed. summary : Summary output of feature and scenarios usage : Prints where step definitions are used. The slowest step definitions (with duration) are listed first. If --dry-run is used the duration is not shown, and step definitions are sorted by filename instead. Use --format rerun --out rerun.txt to write out failing features. You can rerun them with cucumber @rerun.txt. FORMAT can also be the fully qualified class name of your own custom formatter. If the class isn't loaded, Cucumber will attempt to require a file with a relative file name that is the underscore name of the class name. Example: --format Foo::BarZap -&amp;gt; Cucumber will look for foo/bar_zap.rb. You can place the file with this relative path underneath your features/support directory or anywhere on Ruby's LOAD_PATH, for example in a Ru‚Ä¶ </code></pre>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by yasserf

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1702|#1702 IParameterTypeDefinition regexp>
<p>Hi! üëã</p> <p>Firstly, thanks for your work on this project! üôÇ</p> <p>Today I used <a href="https://github.com/ds300/patch-package">patch-package</a> to patch <code>@cucumber/cucumber@7.3.0</code> for the project I'm working on.</p> <p>The IParameterTypeDefinition in code supported both RegExp and arrays of them.</p> <p>Here is the diff that solved my problem:</p> <pre><code>diff --git a/node_modules/@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types.d.ts b/node_modules/@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types.d.ts index 27e0f51..13b4fbe 100644 --- a/node_modules/@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types.d.ts +++ b/node_modules/@cucumber/cucumber/lib/support_code_library_builder/types.d.ts @@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ export interface IDefineTestRunHookOptions { } export interface IParameterTypeDefinition&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; { name: string; - regexp: RegExp; + regexp: RegExp | RegExp[]; transformer: (...match: string[]) =&amp;gt; T; useForSnippets?: boolean; preferForRegexpMatch?: boolean; </code></pre> <p><em>This issue body was <a href="https://github.com/ds300/patch-package/issues/296">partially generated by patch-package</a>.</em></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-22 03:33:10

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by charlierudolph

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1705|#1705 Add more arrow function warnings>
<p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>Some users use arrow functions without realising that they cannot access the world from them.</p> <p><strong>Motivation &amp; context</strong></p> <p>This is currently described in the FAQ, but people still miss it. I've therefore added more sign-posts from the hook, step definition and parameter type docs.</p> <p>I also tweaked the FAQ entry a little.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by nicojs

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1706|#1706 CLI: Targetting the same file multiple times seems to duplicate the results>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong></p> <p>In order to save time, I'm trying to use cucumber-js to target individual features and examples (a lot of them). I'm using these arguments:</p> <pre><code>$ npx cucumber-js "features/foo.feature:33" "features/foo.feature:34" </code></pre> <p>(to target 2 examples)</p> <p>However, instead of saving time, it just takes more time. It seems that both examples are now executed twice.</p> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong></p> <ol><li>Follow the nodejs example: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/docs/nodejs_example.md">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/docs/nodejs_example.md</a></li><li>Execute <code>npx cucumber-js features/simple_math.feature:19</code>, see: <pre><code>... 1 scenario (1 passed) 3 steps (3 passed) </code></pre></li><li>Same for line 20, <code>npx cucumber-js features/simple_math.feature:20</code>, see: <pre><code>... 1 scenario (1 passed) 3 steps (3 passed) </code></pre></li><li>Now, execute <code>npx cucumber-js features/simple_math.feature:19 features/simple_math.feature:20</code>, see: <pre><code>............ 4 scenarios (4 passed) 12 steps (12 passed) </code></pre></li> </ol> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong></p> <pre><code>... 2 scenario (2 passed) 6 steps (6 passed) </code></pre> <p><strong>Desktop (please complete the following information):</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ OS: Windows ‚Ä¢ cucumberjs v7.3.0 ‚Ä¢ npm 6.14.11, node v12.21.0</p> <p><strong>Smartphone (please complete the following information):</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Device: [e.g. iPhone6] ‚Ä¢ OS: [e.g. iOS8.1] ‚Ä¢ Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari] ‚Ä¢ Version [e.g. 22]</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-25 09:41:42

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by sarahgoldman

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1707|#1707 Including the word "reissue" in a tag name breaks tests>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong></p> <p>If I tag a scenario with "<a href="https://github.com/reissue">@reissue</a>" or even a tag name containing that word, e.g. "@reissueassignment", the tests fail with error:</p> <pre><code>[12:25:46] E/launcher - Error: Error: Tag name should have a property "length" that is greater than 0 at Object.ensure (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\tiny_types\src\ensure.ts:31:15) at new Tag (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\core\src\model\tags\Tag.ts:23:9) at new IssueTag (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\core\src\model\tags\IssueTag.ts:10:9) at C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\core\src\model\tags\Tags.ts:17:66 at Array.map (&amp;lt;anonymous&amp;gt;) at MatchesRegExp.transformation (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\core\src\model\tags\Tags.ts:17:53) at MatchesRegExp.MatcherRule.execute (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\tiny_types\src\pattern_matching\rules\MatcherRule.ts:13:21) at StringMatcher.PatternMatcher.else (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\tiny_types\src\pattern_matching\PatternMatcher.ts:17:71) at Function.from (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\core\src\model\tags\Tags.ts:18:18) at C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\cucumber\src\listeners\messages\parser\CucumberMessagesParser.ts:233:80 at Array.map (&amp;lt;anonymous&amp;gt;) at CucumberMessagesParser.scenarioFrom (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\cucumber\src\listeners\messages\parser\CucumberMessagesParser.ts:233:64) at CucumberMessagesParser.parseTestCaseStarted (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\cucumber\src\listeners\messages\parser\CucumberMessagesParser.ts:102:34) at EventEmitter.&amp;lt;anonymous&amp;gt; (C:\jdev2020\git\via_automated_testing\node_modules\@serenity_js\cucumber\src\listeners\messages\CucumberMessagesListener.ts:49:41) at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:323:22) at EventEmitter.emit (domain.js:482:12) [12:25:46] E/launcher - Process exited with error code 100 </code></pre> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:<br /> Tag a scenario with "<a href="https://github.com/reissue">@reissue</a>" or "@reissuesomething".</p> <p><strong>Note</strong>: I am using with protractor-cucumber-framework@~8.0.0</p> <p>Here is my feature file:</p> <pre><code>@VIA-150 @establishment @establishmentdetails Feature: VIA-150 CREATE ASSIGNMENTS All functionality related to creating an assignments @reissue Scenario: 150-16449-AC1-HP2 Given "Coordinator" user is logged in And the user is viewing an establishment that is marked to be reissued an assignment When the user creates an assignment for the establishment Then the system shall display the "Establishment Detail" screen And the establishment shall not display the Reissue badge </code></pre> <p>When I change it to "reissu" without the "e", it works as expected:</p> <pre><code>@VIA-150 @establishment @establishmentdetails Feature: VIA-150 CREATE ASSIGNMENTS All functionality related to creating an assignments @reissu Scenario: 150-16449-AC1-HP2 Given "Coordinator" user is logged in And the user is viewing an establishment that is marked to be reissued an assignment When the user creates an assignment for the establishment Then the system shall display the "Establishment Detail" screen And the establishment shall not display the Reissue badge </code></pre> <p><strong>Is <a href="https://github.com/reissue">@reissue</a> a reserved word and is this documented somewhere, or is this a bug?</strong></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-25 10:07:54

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by nicojs

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1708|#1708 fix(cli): allow targetting same file multiple times>
<p>Fix the issue where the same scenarios are executed multiple times when the feature file is targeted multiple times.</p> <p>Example:</p> <pre><code>$ npx cucumber-js features/simple_math.feature:19 features/simple_math.feature:20 </code></pre> <p>Will now result in:</p> <pre><code>... 2 scenario (2 passed) 6 steps (6 passed) </code></pre> <p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1706">#1706</a></p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by nicojs

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1710|#1710 Open up `const { Cli } = require('@cucumber/cucumber')` for programmatic usage>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> I'm in the process of adding support for cucumber-js in StrykerJS, the mutation testing framework for JavaScript and friends. See <a href="https://github.com/stryker-mutator/stryker-js/pull/2970">stryker-mutator/stryker-js#2970</a></p> <p>I would like to use cucumber programmatically. In fact, I'm already doing that in the MR. However, I realize that I'm using an undocumented API, which I don't like doing, since the implementation could break in a patch release version. I strive to use public APIs only.</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong></p> <p>Would you accept a PR that documents the use of the <code>Cli</code> class for public usage?</p> <pre><code>const { Cli } = require('@cucumber/cucumber') </code></pre> <p>I would add it to your <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/tree/main/docs">docs</a> directory. Either in a new file (<code>programmatic-usage.md</code>) or add it to the <code>cli.md</code> file.</p> <p><strong><em>*Describe alternatives you've considered</em></strong>*</p> <p><strong>Additional context</strong><br /> In order to make mutation testing feasible, we need a programmatic API. Simply calling <code>childProcess.exec</code> to execute cucumber-js would work, but is terrible for performance since Stryker will run cucumber-js many times during a mutation testing run.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-28 02:29:46

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1711|#1711 Proposal: Programmatic API for running cucumber-js>
<p><strong>Problem</strong></p> <p>Currently we don't have a good way to programmatically run cucumber-js. The need is from two angles:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Testing - for the CCK and our acceptance tests in the project ‚Ä¢ Projects that use cucumber-js as part of a framework (e.g. Serenity, Stryker)</p> <p><strong>As-is</strong></p> <p>What tends to happen at the moment is a new instance of <code>Cli</code> is created with <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/compatibility/cck_spec.ts#L41">strung-together argv input</a>. It's obviously very unweildy and also <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1710">isn't on the public API</a>.</p> <p>Sometimes (possibly due to perceived fragility of the above) frameworks will just rely on the cucumber-js CLI but struggle to find ways to integrate and have their own options.</p> <p>The <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/src/runtime/index.ts#L42"><code>Runtime</code> class</a> is currently part of the public API but it's not useful in these contexts, depending on the pickles and support code to be provided by the caller.</p> <p><strong>Proposal</strong></p> <p>Two components in the project:</p> <p><strong><code>runCucumber</code></strong></p> <p>New async function that executes a test run in-process. Responsibilities:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Accept an options object with a nice interface ‚Ä¢ Do the "work" of resolving pickles, loading support code, running test cases, orchestrating formatters ‚Ä¢ Return a promise that resolves to a result</p> <p>This would be part of the public API and we'd encourage framework maintainers to use it when "wrapping" cucumber-js. We'd also use it for our own testing.</p> <p>As much as possible, it would avoid direct interaction with <code>process</code>, instead accepting normalised options and stream interfaces for output, and leaving it to the caller to decide how to exit based on the result or an unhandled error.</p> <p>Also <code>Runtime</code> should come off the public API as it's really an internal thing.</p> <p><strong>CLI</strong></p> <p>Effectively a "client" of <code>runCucumber</code>. Responsibilities:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Parse input from process arguments (via commander) ‚Ä¢ Load profiles (which as it stands are a feature of the CLI) and mix those arguments in as needed ‚Ä¢ Call <code>runCucumber</code> with the resolved options ‚Ä¢ Exit as appropriate based on the results</p> <p>This would continue to <em>not</em> be on the public API. Also it would only use functions/interfaces that <em>are</em> on the public API, such that we could easily break it out into its own package at some point, as is a common pattern now with projects like <a href="https://github.com/facebook/jest/tree/master/packages">Jest</a>.</p> <p>This decoupling also paves the way for some interesting new CLI features without having them bleed into the internals, e.g.:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ <code>--gui</code> for the cucumber-electron stuff ‚Ä¢ <code>--interactive</code> for quick targeted reruns when TDD'ing</p> <p><strong>Timescale</strong></p> <p>We'd target this at the upcoming 8.0.0 release. I'm ready to gets started on this today.</p>
Assignees
davidjgoss
Labels
üíî breaking change, ‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-29 13:10:53

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by nicojs

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1712|#1712 Allow to uninclude features>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> Let's say you have this <code>cucumber.js</code> config:</p> <pre><code>// cucumber.js module.exports = { default: 'my-features/**.feature' } </code></pre> <p>And you now want to focus 1 feature in a feature file:</p> <pre><code>$ npx cucumber-js my-features/math.feature:7 </code></pre> <p>In addition to the scenario on line 7 in math.feature, all other feature files will be executed. I've located the code that is responsible here: </p> <p><a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/4ef971016858bcc3ad5aa3af57439dff5a158277/src/cli/configuration_builder.ts#L125-L141">cucumber-js/src/cli/configuration_builder.ts</a></p> <p>Lines 125 to 141 in &lt;/cucumber/cucumber-js/commit/4ef971016858bcc3ad5aa3af57439dff5a158277|4ef9710&gt;</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong><br /> I would personally think that <em>command line positional arguments</em> should <strong>not</strong> be merged together with the profile positional arguments, instead it should override them. Note: I do think properties should still be merged, just not positional arguments.</p> <p><strong>Describe alternatives you've considered</strong><br /> A way to "uninclude" files would be a valid alternative:</p> <pre><code>$ npx cucumber-js !****/**.feature my-feature/math.feature:7 </code></pre> <p><strong>Additional context</strong><br /> I've run into this while developing the cucumber plugin for StrykerJS. We want to be able to focus tests, regardless of positional arguments in the profile.</p> <p>We can also think of another solution when defining the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1711">programmable API</a></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-06-30 02:22:49

<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1713|#1713 cli: remove deprecated retryTagFilter option>
<p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>Remove the camelCase version of this CLI option as deprecated in 7.0.0 via <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1293">#1293</a>.</p> <p><strong>Type of change</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Breaking change (will cause existing functionality to not<br /> work as expected)</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é My code follows the code style of this project. ‚òê My change requires a change to the documentation. ‚òê I have updated the documentation accordingly. ‚òëÔ∏é I have read the &lt;../CONTRIBUTING.md|<strong>CONTRIBUTING</strong>&gt; document. ‚òê I have added tests to cover my changes. ‚òëÔ∏é All new and existing tests passed.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

change for more details</a>.</p> <p><strong><a href="https://togithub.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/releases/v4.3.4"><code>v4.3.4</code></a></strong></p> <p><a <code>SolutionBuilderHost**</code> APIs ‚Ä¢ uses the transforms given by <code>getCustomTransformers</code> in Builder Program instances when running <code>emit()</code> methods in cases where <code>customTransforms</code> are not given.</p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/microsoft/TypeScript/pull/44489">See the change for more details</a></p> <p><strong><a 2021-06-30 20:30:19

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1719|#1719 chore(deps): update dependency mocha to v9>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> mochajs/mocha <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B901--2021-06-18|&lt;code">https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B901--2021-06-18|<code</a>v9.0.1</code>&gt;</strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/compare/v9.0.0...v9.0.1">Compare Source</a></p> <p><strong>üî© Other</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4657">#‚Äã4657</a>: Browser: add separate bundle for modern browsers (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>)</p> <p>We added a separate browser bundle <code>mocha-es2018.js</code> in javascript ES2018, as we skipped the transpilation down to ES5. This is an <strong>experimental step towards freezing Mocha's support of IE11</strong>.</p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4653">#‚Äã4653</a>: ESM: proper version check in <code>hasStableEsmImplementation</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/alexander-fenster"><strong>@‚Äãalexander-fenster</strong></a>)</p> <p><strong><a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B900--2021-06-07|&lt;code">https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B900--2021-06-07|<code</a>v9.0.0</code>&gt;</strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/compare/v8.4.0...v9.0.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p><strong>üí• Breaking Changes</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4633">#‚Äã4633</a>: <strong>Drop Node.js v10.x support</strong> (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>) ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4635">#‚Äã4635</a>: <code>import</code>-first loading of test files (<a href="https://togithub.com/giltayar"><strong>@‚Äãgiltayar</strong></a>)</p> <p><strong>Mocha is going ESM-first!</strong> This means that it will now use ESM <code>import(test_file)</code> to load the test files, instead of the CommonJS <code>require(test_file)</code>. This is not a problem, as <code>import</code> can also load most files that <code>require</code> does. In the rare cases where this fails, it will fallback to <code>require(...)</code>. This ESM-first approach is the next step in Mocha's ESM migration, and allows ESM loaders to load and transform the test file.</p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4636">#‚Äã4636</a>: Remove deprecated <code>utils.lookupFiles()</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>) ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4638">#‚Äã4638</a>: Limit the size of <code>actual</code>/<code>expected</code> for <code>diff</code> generation (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>) ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4389">#‚Äã4389</a>: Refactoring: Consuming log-symbols alternate to code for win32 in reporters/base (<a href="https://togithub.com/MoonSupport"><strong>@‚ÄãMoonSupport</strong></a>)</p> <p><strong>üéâ Enhancements</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4640">#‚Äã4640</a>: Add new option <code>--dry-run</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>)</p> <p><strong>üêõ Fixes</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4128">#‚Äã4128</a>: Fix: control stringification of error message (<a href="https://togithub.com/syeutyu"><strong>@‚Äãsyeutyu</strong></a>)</p> <p><strong>üî© Other</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4646">#‚Äã4646</a>: Deprecate <code>Runner(suite: Suite, delay: boolean)</code> signature (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>) ‚Ä¢ <a href="https://togithub.com/mochajs/mocha/issues/4643">#‚Äã4643</a>: Update production dependencies (<a href="https://togithub.com/juergba"><strong>@‚Äãjuergba</strong></a>)</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Configuration</strong></p> <p>üìÖ <strong>Schedule</strong>: "on the first day of the month" (UTC).</p> <p>üö¶ <strong>Automerge</strong>: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.</p> <p>‚ôªÔ∏è <strong>Rebasing</strong>: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or you tick the rebase/retry checkbox.</p> <p>üîï <strong>Ignore</strong>: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.</p> <hr /> <p>‚òê If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box.</p> <hr /> <p>This PR has been generated by <a href="https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a>. View repository job log <a href="https://app.renovatebot.com/dashboard#github/cucumber/cucumber-js">here</a>.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1720|#1720 fix(deps): update dependency commander to v8>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> tj/commander.js <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B800-2021-06-25|&lt;code">https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#%E2%80%8B800-2021-06-25|<code</a>v8.0.0</code>&gt;</strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/compare/v7.2.0...v8.0.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p><strong>Added</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <code>.argument(name, description)</code> for adding command-arguments ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1490">#‚Äã1490</a>]) ‚Ä¢ supports default value for optional command-arguments ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1508">#‚Äã1508</a>]) ‚Ä¢ supports custom processing function ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1508">#‚Äã1508</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.createArgument()</code> factory method ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1497">#‚Äã1497</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.addArgument()</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1490">#‚Äã1490</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>Argument</code> supports <code>.choices()</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1525">#‚Äã1525</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.showHelpAfterError()</code> to display full help or a custom message after an error ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1534">#‚Äã1534</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.hook()</code> with support for <code>'preAction'</code> and <code>'postAction'</code> callbacks ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1514">#‚Äã1514</a>]) ‚Ä¢ client typing of <code>.opts()</code> return type using TypeScript generics ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1539">#‚Äã1539</a>]) ‚Ä¢ the number of command-arguments is checked for programs without an action handler ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1502">#‚Äã1502</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.getOptionValue()</code> and <code>.setOptionValue()</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1521">#‚Äã1521</a>])</p> <p><strong>Changed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ refactor and simplify TypeScript declarations (with no default export) ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1520">#‚Äã1520</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>.parseAsync()</code> is now declared as <code>async</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1513">#‚Äã1513</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <em>Breaking:</em> <code>Help</code> method <code>.visibleArguments()</code> returns array of <code>Argument</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1490">#‚Äã1490</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <em>Breaking:</em> Commander 8 requires Node.js 12 or higher ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1500">#‚Äã1500</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <em>Breaking:</em> <code>CommanderError</code> code <code>commander.invalidOptionArgument</code> renamed <code>commander.invalidArgument</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1508">#‚Äã1508</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <em>Breaking:</em> TypeScript declaration for <code>.addTextHelp()</code> callback no longer allows result of <code>undefined</code>, now just <code>string</code> ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1516">#‚Äã1516</a>]) ‚Ä¢ refactor <code>index.tab</code> into a file per class ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1522">#‚Äã1522</a>]) ‚Ä¢ remove help suggestion from "unknown command" error message (see <code>.showHelpAfteError()</code>) ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1534">#‚Äã1534</a>]) ‚Ä¢ <code>Command</code> property <code>.arg</code> initialised to empty array (was previously undefined) ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1529">#‚Äã1529</a>]) ‚Ä¢ update dependencies</p> <p><strong>Deprecated</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ second parameter of <code>cmd.description(desc, argDescriptions)</code> for adding argument descriptions ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1490">#‚Äã1490</a>]) ‚Ä¢ (use new <code>.argument(name, description)</code> instead) ‚Ä¢ <code>InvalidOptionArgumentError</code> (replaced by <code>InvalidArgumentError</code>) ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1508">#‚Äã1508</a>])</p> <p><strong>Removed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ <em>Breaking:</em> TypeScript declaration for default export of global <code>Command</code> object ([<a href="https://togithub.com/tj/commander.js/issues/1520">#‚Äã1520</a>]) ‚Ä¢ (still available as named <code>program</code> export)</p> <p><strong>Migration Tips</strong></p> <p>If you have a simple program without an action handler, you will now get an error if<br /> there are missing command-arguments.</p> <pre><code>program .option('-d, --debug') .arguments('&amp;lt;file&amp;gt;'); program.parse(); </code></pre> <pre><code>$ node trivial.js error: missing required argument 'file' </code></pre> <p>If you want to show the help in this situation, you could check the arguments before parsing:</p> <pre><code>if (process.argv.length === 2) &lt;a href="http://program.help"&gt;program.help&lt;/a&gt;(); program.parse(); </code></pre> <p>Or, you might choose to show the help after any user error:</p> <pre><code>program.showHelpAfterError(); </code></pre> <hr /> <p><strong>Configuration</strong></p> <p>üìÖ <strong>Schedule</strong>: "on the first day of the month" (UTC).</p> <p>üö¶ <strong>Automerge</strong>: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.</p> <p>‚ôªÔ∏è <strong>Rebasing</strong>: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or you tick the rebase/retry checkbox.</p> <p>üîï <strong>Ignore</strong>: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.</p> <hr /> <p>‚òê If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box.</p> <hr /> <p>This PR has been generated by <a href="https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a>. [cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1721|#1721 Add possibility to opt-out from printing step attachments when scenario is not successful>
<p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>Refs. <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1136">#1136</a></p> <p>I've added a scenario to show a new <code>--format-options</code> that would let the possibility to opt-out from the attachments being printed when a scenario is not successful.</p> <p>That option is named <code>printStepAttachments</code> and is presumably true per default.</p> <p>If the fix is not too complex, I plan to use this PR as a step-by-step tutorial for new contributors.</p> <p><strong>Motivation &amp; context</strong></p> <p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1136">#1136</a><br /> May be a good opportunity for a "first new contribution" tutorial</p> <p><strong>Type of change</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ‚Ä¢ New feature (non-breaking change which adds new behaviour)</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>‚òê My code follows the code style of this project. ‚òê I have updated the documentation accordingly. ‚òê I have read the &lt;../CONTRIBUTING.md|<strong>CONTRIBUTING</strong>&gt; document. ‚òê I have added tests to cover my changes. ‚òê All new and existing tests passed. ‚òê CHANGELOG has been updated</p>
