[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1722|#1722 Add an unindent tagged template test helper>
<p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>Addition of a tagged template literal to avoid messing with indentation in test files.</p> <p>Before:</p> <pre><code> // Assert expect(output).to.eql(`\ ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Pattern / Text ‚îÇ Duration ‚îÇ Location ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ abc ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:11 ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ /def?/ ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:16 ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ ghi ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:25 ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò `) </code></pre> <p>After:</p> <pre><code> // Assert expect(output).to.eql(unindent` ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Pattern / Text ‚îÇ Duration ‚îÇ Location ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ abc ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:11 ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ /def?/ ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:16 ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ ghi ‚îÇ UNUSED ‚îÇ usage_steps.ts:25 ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò `) </code></pre> <p><strong>Motivation &amp; context</strong></p> <p>Indentation is important for readability.<br /> Preserving it in the flow of the source file helps a lot reading and writing those files.</p> <p>While I try to write kinda tutorial on how to contribute to the code, I was annoyed to explain why some tests had to have some unindented stuff üòÖ</p> <p><strong>Type of change</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Refactoring/debt (improvement to code design or tooling without changing behaviour)</p> <p><strong>Note to other contributors</strong></p> <p>I have added some JSDoc to provide a sample of usage through VSCode and other IDEs.<br /> We may consider documenting the code for this purpose.<br /> But if other contributors disagree, we can just remove that one and forget about that.</p> <p><a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24386780/124724592-69a5b080-df0c-11eb-9f56-a0a4b6841e92.png">image</a></p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by shawnbot

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1724|#1724 How best to modify step results?>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> This isn't really a problem, but more of an implementation/API question.</p> <p>I'm looking into whether it's feasible to build a Cucumber integration with <a href="https://ghostinspector.com/">Ghost Inspector</a> ("GI"), but there's a pretty fundamental difference in the way that the two tools want to run tests: Cucumber wants to execute each step in series and know immediately if one has failed, whereas with GI I was hoping to:</p> <ol><li>Use step definitions to build the test suite payload</li><li>Send the test suite payload at the end of each scenario</li><li>Set the status of each step once the test results come back</li> </ol> <p>I've figured out 1 and 2, but 3 has me stumped. Is this possible, and if so, are there either examples of how to do it that I could look at or some pseudo-code for how to "correctly" modify step results? Thank you! üôè</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by charlierudolph

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1725|#1725 remove support for generators>
<p>Don't need generators anymore given async / await has been out for a long time.</p> <p>Initially held off to allow until we had BeforeStep / AfterStep hooks as the definition function wrapper had been used for things like that</p> <p>Also removes bluebird (between lodash / bluebird - removing 20% of our bundle: <a href="https://bundlephobia.com/package/@cucumber/cucumber@7.3.0">https://bundlephobia.com/package/@cucumber/cucumber@7.3.0</a>)</p> <p>closes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1021">#1021</a></p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by karthrav

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1727|#1727 node_modules\@cucumber\messages\dist\src\index.d.ts has an import issue>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> Line number 3 i.e. import { version } from '../package.json'; throws a compile error TS2614: Module '"<em>.json"' has no exported member 'version'. Did you mean to use 'import version from "</em>.json"' instead?</p> <p>This occurs only when you use "tsc --resolveJsonModule false" compile command.<br /> Issue does not occur if you use simply tsc.</p> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:</p> <ol><li>Compile your project with tsc --resolveJsonModule false</li><li>See error</li><li>Compile your project with tsc</li><li>No error</li> </ol> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong><br /> No error should occur when compiling with tsc --resolveJsonModule false</p> <p><strong>Screenshots</strong><br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87373079/125452193-4308a756-adc3-4c86-ae94-a98df5af797b.png">image</a><br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87373079/125453237-f32a03f3-e39b-43f2-87fd-a5ada792a69a.png">image</a></p> <p><strong>Desktop:</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ OS: Windows</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by fguidobaldi

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1728|#1728 Dynamic Examples>
<p>Is there any way to dynamically generate examples?</p> <p>I would like to be able to execute the same scenario with different inputs (that share the same expected result) , not just hardcoding these inputs, but generating them programmatically. The current approach it isn't scalable, and it's very expensive to maintain.</p> <p>I understand that maybe this isn't the typical UC for Cucumber, that's why I'm trying to find out some sort of workaround to this issue. The objective is to reuse when/then steps, without having to write different scenarios, but to execute them the number of times necessary according to the input.</p> <p>Scenario Outline: User logging<br /> Given there is &lt;user_id&gt; user<br /> When the user tries to login<br /> Then I should receive 200 as status code</p> <p>‚Ä¢ I verify some response value ‚Ä¢ I verify another response value</p> <p>Examples:<br /> | user_id |<br /> | 1 |<br /> | 2 |<br /> | 3 |<br /> | 4 |<br /> | 5 |<br /> | 6 |</p> <hr /> <p>Scenario: User logging<br /> Given there are 6 users --&gt; THIS STEP GENERATES 6 USER_ID<br /> When the user tries to login<br /> Then I should receive 200 as status code</p> <p>‚Ä¢ I verify some response value ‚Ä¢ I verify another response value</p> <p><strong>WHEN and THEN should be executed 6 times (once for each user_id)</strong></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-14 13:40:22

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by teststack-git

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1729|#1729 Parallel Testing with Cross Browser Functionality>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> I am attempting to set up my teams CucumberJS implementation after we identified some short-comings within Jest-Cucumber (notably the lack of Cucumber json reporting). The benefit of using Jest-Cucumber, however is that I can define browsers to use within the config file and the step definition files would know to run tests against those browsers. This also meant that I could achieve parallelization using all tests with all browsers and have it reflected in a report.</p> <p>I'm having trouble finding a similar solution within CucumberJS as it seems to require a single browser instance at a time. I can use the process.env.BROWSER to sort of dynamically pass in a browser via a nodejs CLI, however that means I would need a separate call for each browser, which then turns into 3 Cucumber reports. I've found the section within the docs that showcase parallel testing, however nothing in regards to browser management. Is this something that is possible with CucumberJS? If so, is there an example that I can look at with that sort of implementation or at the very least the usage of a config.js file that can achieve those goals?</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong><br /> A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.</p> <p><strong>Describe alternatives you've considered</strong><br /> A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.</p> <p><strong>Additional context</strong><br /> Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-14 14:04:54

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by eoola

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1735|#1735 Cucumber's own features fail when parent directory contains parentheses>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> Whenever the parent directory has parentheses in its name, I noticed the cucumber features tests start to fail. I also noticed that in the tests that are run, the path for the parent directory drops the parentheses from the path name. For the above reason, the path can not be found for a specified directory.</p> <pre><code>22) Scenario: # features/usage_json_formatter.feature:8 ‚úî Before # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 ‚úî Given a file named "features/a.feature" with: # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 """ Feature: a feature Scenario: a scenario Given step A And step A When step B Then step C """ ‚úî And a file named "features/step_definitions/steps.js" with: # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 """ const {When} = require('@cucumber/cucumber') When('step A', function() {}); When('step B', function() {}); When('step C', function() {}); When(/step D/, function() {}); """ ‚úî When I run cucumber-js with `--format usage-json` # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 ‚úñ Then it outputs the usage data: # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 | PATTERN | PATTERN_TYPE | URI | LINE | NUMBER OF MATCHES | | step A | CucumberExpression | features/step_definitions/steps.js | 3 | 2 | | step B | CucumberExpression | features/step_definitions/steps.js | 4 | 1 | | step C | CucumberExpression | features/step_definitions/steps.js | 5 | 1 | | step D | RegularExpression | features/step_definitions/steps.js | 6 | 0 | AssertionError + expected - actual -13 +3 at /Users/emmanuelola/Documents/Cucumber (x)/cucumber-js/features/step_definitions/usage_json_steps.ts:15:30 at Array.forEach (&amp;lt;anonymous&amp;gt;) at World.&amp;lt;anonymous&amp;gt; (/Users/emmanuelola/Documents/Cucumber (x)/cucumber-js/features/step_definitions/usage_json_steps.ts:9:18) ‚úî After # ../../Cucumber x/cucumber-js/src/support_code_library_builder/build_helpers.ts:13 </code></pre> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:</p> <ol><li>Go to 'the root directory for the project'</li><li>Add a parent directory with a parentheses in its name (include some letters within the parentheses)</li><li>Open the project in your desired IDE</li><li>Run the tests</li><li>See error</li> </ol> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong><br /> Passing tests</p> <p><strong>Screenshots</strong><br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54866720/126218939-c2815926-79e2-4b3e-9af5-0bf987e8598f.png">Untitled</a></p> <p><strong>Desktop (please complete the following information):</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ OS: macOS Big Sur 11.4 ‚Ä¢ Version: Main Repository Branch</p> <p><strong>Additional context</strong><br /> Trying to run tests to contribute to cucumber-js with <a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a> as part of the Cucumber first timers mob and the folder where I keep my code happens to have parentheses in its name. For more context, this is not the folder shown in the screenshot, that's simply provided for testing purposes.</p>
Labels
üè¶ debt, ‚úÖ accepted, beginners mob candidate

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by customcommander

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1738|#1738 New tag expression `@^foo` ‚Äî select all tags that start with 'foo'>
<p><em>I'm sure it must have been suggested before but I cannot find a similar ticket in this repo. Apologies in advance if this discussion has already been settled.</em></p> <hr /> <p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong></p> <p>We have naming convention for tags e.g.</p> <pre><code>@featureAAA @featureBBB @featureCCC @regressionAAA @regressionBBB @regressionCCC </code></pre> <p>We apply these tags on scenarios across many files. We can't have all the features scenarios in one directory and all the regressions scenarios in another. We need to be able to mix and match.</p> <p>With such a setup the only way to run either all features or all regressions scenarios is to apply a general tag <code>@feature</code> and <code>@scenario</code> as well.</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong></p> <p>Would we nice if we could have a tag expression such as <code>@^feature</code> which means "all tags that starts with <code>feature</code>"</p> <p><strong>Describe alternatives you've considered</strong></p> <p>The alternative is the apply a global tag as well e.g.</p> <pre><code>@featureAAA @feature Scenario: ‚Ä¶ Given ‚Ä¶ When ‚Ä¶ Then ‚Ä¶ </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-24 11:08:57

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request merged by charlierudolph

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1726|#1726 (deps) update dependency lint>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-26 01:55:11

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by tim-yao

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1739|#1739 Reporting for retries>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> Cucumber report(html, json formatter) doesn't include retried details when using <code>--retry</code>.</p> <p>When we use <code>--retry</code>, report will mark the flaky test pass if there is one retry get pass. That is working as expected. However, if we can also add some details of <code>retry</code> in the report, e.g show the number of failed attempt, that will help us to find potential intermittent bugs, instead of hiding bugs.</p> <p>The idea is coming from <a href="https://automationpanda.com/2021/06/14/are-automated-test-retries-good-or-bad/">https://automationpanda.com/2021/06/14/are-automated-test-retries-good-or-bad/</a></p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong><br /> Something on the report to indicate there are retry attempts happened. Like the number of failed attempt. A example:<br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31641325/126961755-ac5ac219-2b6f-4d04-adb4-e3cc94d22fc3.png">specflow-report</a></p>
Labels
‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-28 10:09:37

[cucumber/cucumber-js] New release Release - v7.3.1 published by davidjgoss

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/releases/tag/v7.3.1|Release - v7.3.1>
<p><strong>Deprecated</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Deprecate <code>setDefinitionFunctionWrapper</code> and step definition option <code>wrapperOptions</code></p> <p><strong>Fixed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Prevent duplicate scenario execution where the same feature is targeted in multiple line expressions (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1706">#1706</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fixed reports banner to point to <a href="https://cucumber.io/docs/cucumber/environment-variables/">new docs</a> about environment variables ‚Ä¢ Re-add color functions for use with custom formatters <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1582">1582</a> ‚Ä¢ IParameterTypeDefinition regexp fix <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1702">1702</a></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-29 07:20:28

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by mbrzozowski-merapar

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1740|#1740 Unable to get StepName from ITestStepHookParameter in BeforeStep hook>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> I am trying to pull current step name out of ITestStepHookParameter in the BeforeStep hook:</p> <pre><code>BeforeStep(async function(testStep) { // Should be step name, is scenario name instead const stepName = testStep.pickle.name; // stepObj is undefined const stepObj = testStep.pickle.steps.filter(step =&amp;gt; { return step.id === testStep.testStepId }); }); </code></pre> <p><strong>Cucumber-js version: 7.3.1</strong></p> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong><br /> I would expect the <code>testStep.testStepId</code> to be present in the array of steps in the <code>testStep.pickle.steps</code> object. However, that's not the case and the <code>testStepId</code> does not much any of the steps in the array.</p> <p>Also, the <code>testStep.pickle.name</code> contains the name of the whole scenario, not the concrete step.<br /> As a result, it is not able to pull out the step name inside the BeforeStep hook.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-29 08:02:44

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by dambler

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1741|#1741 setDefinitionFunctionWrapper used for overall Scenario timeout>
<p>After upgrading to 7.3.1, I can see the deprecation notice for the <code>setDefinitionFunctionWrapper</code> method, suggesting to use the new <code>BeforeStep</code> and <code>AfterStep</code> methods instead.</p> <p>I use <code>setDefinitionFunctionWrapper</code> in a project to control Scenario timeouts and I am at a loss with working out how I can achieve similar behaviour using these new step hooks.</p> <p>The general gist of the code I am currently using is:</p> <pre><code>const MAX_DURATION_IN_MS = 90_000; let timeout: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined; let maxEndtime = Date.now() + MAX_DURATION_IN_MS; const clearExecutionTimeout = () =&amp;gt; { if (!timeout) return; clearTimeout(timeoutId); timeout = undefined; }; setDefinitionFunctionWrapper( (fn: Function) =&amp;gt; async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) { // Only actual test steps should use this timeout value. const shouldUseTimeOut = args[0]?.pickle === undefined &amp;amp;&amp;amp; args[0]?.result === undefined &amp;amp;&amp;amp; maxEndtime !== undefined; const promises: Promise&amp;lt;void | string&amp;gt;[] = [fn.apply(this, args)]; if (shouldUseTimeOut) { promises.push( new Promise((resolve) =&amp;gt; { timeout = global.setTimeout( () =&amp;gt; resolve('skipped'), Math.max(maxEndtime! - Date.now(), 0), ); return timeoutId; }), ); } const result = await Promise.race(promises); clearExecutionTimeout(); return result; }, ); Before(() =&amp;gt; { maxEndtime = Date.now() + MAX_DURATION_IN_MS; }); </code></pre> <p>I am doing this as I am running these Scenarios inside an AWS lambda and I need to control their execution timeouts to ensure that we get feature JSON output before the handler exits completely.</p> <p>I have tried setting a timeout in a <code>BeforeStep</code> hook, but retuning 'skipped' there is ignored. I have tried throwing inside a timeout also, but that causes the process to exit non-cleanly (i.e. the json report is not generated).</p> <p>Any ideas if what I am trying to do is actually possible anymore without <code>setDefinitionFunctionWrapper</code>?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
GitHub
2021-07-29 14:02:33

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1742|#1742 Bump reindent-template-literals to 1.1.0>
<p>I've made an update in the reindent-template-literals package to not process last blank lines, as this is done with first lines.</p> <p>That has a small impact on the code: where the reindent function is used, we need to add an extra blank lines in the templates when the expected strings ends with a new-line.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by renovate[bot]

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1760|#1760 chore(deps): update dependency ts-node to v10.1.0>
<p><a href="https://renovatebot.com">WhiteSource Renovate</a></p> <p>This PR contains the following updates:</p> <hr /> <p><strong>Release Notes</strong> TypeStrong/ts-node <strong><a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/releases/v10.1.0"><code>v10.1.0</code></a></strong></p> <p><a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/compare/v10.0.0...v10.1.0">Compare Source</a></p> <p>Questions about this release? Ask in the official discussion thread: <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1390">#‚Äã1390</a></p> <p><strong>Added</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Add <code>"moduleType"</code> option to override module type -- CommonJS or ECMAScript -- on select files. (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/module-type-overrides">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1342">#‚Äã1342</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1371">#‚Äã1371</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1376">#‚Äã1376</a>) ‚Ä¢ Useful when a configuration file, for example <code>webpack.config.ts</code>, must execute as CommonJS but the rest of the project is ESM ‚Ä¢ selectively overrides <code>package.json</code> <code>"type"</code> and <code>tsconfig.json</code> <code>"module"</code> ‚Ä¢ akin to <code>.cjs</code> and <code>.mjs</code> extensions, but for <code>.ts</code> and <code>.tsx</code> files ‚Ä¢ thanks to <a href="https://togithub.com/jayaddison">@‚Äãjayaddison</a> for help on test coverage ‚Ä¢ Implement <code>"extends"</code> support for <code>"ts-node"</code> options in <code>tsconfig.json</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1328">#‚Äã1328</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1356">#‚Äã1356</a>) ‚Ä¢ <code>"ts-node": {}</code> options will be parsed from extended tsconfigs ‚Ä¢ allows sharing and deduplicating ts-node configuration ‚Ä¢ Un-deprecate <code>scope</code> and <code>scopeDir</code>; add both to CLI and <code>tsconfig.json</code> options; un-deprecate <code>TS_NODE_SCOPE</code> env var; add <code>TS_NODE_SCOPE_DIR</code> env var (<a href="https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/options">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1346">#‚Äã1346</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1367">#‚Äã1367</a>)</p> <p><strong>Changed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Improve error messages thrown by native ESM loader hooks (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1357">#‚Äã1357</a>, <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1373">#‚Äã1373</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/tars0x9752">@‚Äãtars0x9752</a> ‚Ä¢ messages more closely match node; are more descriptive ‚Ä¢ Emit <code>"ts-node"</code> object at the top of <code>--showConfig</code> output instead of the bottom (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1355">#‚Äã1355</a>)</p> <p><strong>Fixed</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1282">#‚Äã1282</a>: Set correct globals in <code>[stdin]</code>, <code>[eval]</code>, and <code>&amp;lt;repl&amp;gt;</code> contexts (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1333">#‚Äã1333</a>) ‚Ä¢ More closely align ts-node's behavior with vanilla node ‚Ä¢ Affects the interactive REPL, piping to stdin, and <code>ts-node -e</code> ‚Ä¢ Matches node's behavior for globals <code>__filename</code>, <code>__dirname</code>, <code>module</code> and sub-fields of <code>module</code>, <code>exports</code>, and builtin module aliases <code>fs</code>, etc ‚Ä¢ Fix <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1343">#‚Äã1343</a>: Set swc option <code>keepClassNames</code> to <code>true</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1344">#‚Äã1344</a>) ‚Ä¢ Fix: <a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1387">#‚Äã1387</a>: REPL outputs 'use strict' after first empty line of input (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1388">#‚Äã1388</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/ejose19">@‚Äãejose19</a></p> <p><strong>Docs</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Update ESM docs to say that env vars <em>are</em> supported with <code>node --loader ts-node/esm</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1007">docs</a>) (<a href="https://togithub.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1379">#‚Äã1379</a>)</p> <p><a href="https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/milestone/3">https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/milestone/3</a></p> Please <a href="https://gist.github.com/sindresorhus/a39789f98801d908bbc7ff3ecc99d99c">read this</a>. ‚Ä¢ Rename <code>main</code> and <code>windows</code> to <code>mainSymbols</code> and <code>fallbackSymbols</code> (<a href="https://togithub.com/sindresorhus/figures/issues/78">#‚Äã78</a>) <a href="https://togithub.com/sindresorhus/figures/commit/483ed89"><code>483ed89</code></a> ‚Ä¢ Separate <code>replaceSymbols()</code> method (<a href="https://togithub.com/sindresorhus/figures/issues/77">#‚Äã77</a>) <a <https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1765|#1765 Add retro notes from new contributors ensemble>
<p>Each of the new-contributors ensemble sessions we've run, we've held a 15-minute<br /> retrospective at the end.</p> <p>I'm not sure where's the best place to put these notes, but I felt like maybe it didn't really do any harm just to put them right here. I'm hopeful we can start to capture more feedback about specific changes we can make to the codebase to make it more welcoming, as time goes on.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Pull request opened by mattwynne

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/pull/1766|#1766 Use typescript incremental build to speed up compilation>
<p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>Switch to the <code>--build</code> compilation option when compiling TypeScript.</p> <p><strong>Motivation &amp; context</strong></p> <p>This <a href="https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/project-references.html">option</a> for the TypeScript compiler speeds up compilation, making it a bit quicker to run the tests.</p> <p>On my machine, this brings the time to run <code>yarn test</code> down from ~100 seconds to ~70 seconds:</p> <p>Before:</p> <pre><code>‚ûú yarn test ... ‚ú® Done in 107.57s. yarn test 102.80s user 11.68s system 106% cpu 1:48.00 total </code></pre> <p>After:</p> <pre><code>‚ûú yarn test ... ‚ú® Done in 88.25s. yarn test 70.84s user 8.79s system 89% cpu 1:28.64 total </code></pre> <p><strong>Type of change</strong></p> <p>‚Ä¢ Refactoring/debt (improvement to code design or tooling without changing behaviour)</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é My code follows the code style of this project. ‚òê My change requires a change to the documentation. ‚òê I have updated the documentation accordingly. ‚òëÔ∏é I have read the &lt;../CONTRIBUTING.md|<strong>CONTRIBUTING</strong>&gt; document. ‚òê I have added tests to cover my changes. ‚òëÔ∏é All new and existing tests passed.</p>
Comments

[cucumber/cucumber-js] Issue opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1768|#1768 Exit status is 1 when running with --dry-run>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong></p> <p>Running <code>cucumber-js --dry-run</code> exits with <code>1</code>.</p> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong></p> <p>I expected a <code>0</code> since nothing is run.</p> <p><strong>Context</strong></p> <p>I'm building an LSP language server which will spawn cucumber in dry-run mode (to capture step definitions and steps so we can build up an autocomplete index). Because it exits with <code>1</code> I'm unable to tell whether the command failed because of a <em>real</em> error or not.</p>
Labels
üêõ bug
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>

sdeteng28
2023-01-19 11:20:17

Hi All, I recently started working on cypress cucumber. How can I run several scenarios for various grids page in the same feature file? Three Hyperlinks [users, clients, and customers] are on one page. Each link when you click it loads a new grid of data with reports and date-picker components.

For example: I have Users link, clients link and customers link . Each tab(page) has reports and a datepicker calendar.

Report.feature contains the following scenarios scenario1: generate a recurring monthly report scenario2: generate a recurring weekly report scenario3: generate a one-time report

All of the scenarios should run for one grid initially, go to another grid, and finish three scenarios. I want to send user grid input, client grid input, and customer grid input in a single feature file.

Thanks in advance.
